gurmukhi: nMd ko nMd bfo suKkMd irpuAir surMd sbu`iD ibswrd ]Awnn cMd pRBw khu mMd khY kib sXwm jpY ijh nwrd ]
transliteration: Nand Ko Nand Bado Soukh Kand Ripuar(i) Surind Sabuddh(i) Bisaarad|| Oonan Channd Prabhaa Kauh Mand Kahai Kabi Syaam Japai Jih Naarad||
translation: Krishna, the son of Nand, is the giver of comfort to all, enemy of Indra, and master of true intellect; the face of the Lord, who is perfect in all arts, ever gives its mild light like the moon; the poet Shyam says that the sage Narada also remembers him,

gurmukhi: qw igr kop auTwie lXo joaU swDn ko hrqw duK dwrd ]myG pry auprXo n kCU pCuqwie gey giH ko auT bwrd ]369]
transliteration: Taa Gir Kop Outhaae Layo Jooo Saadhan Ko Hartaa Doukh Daarad|| Megh Dare Udaryo Na Kachhodh Pachhudaae Gad Grih Ko Outh Baarad||369||
translation: The same Krishna, being highly infuriated, carried the mountain and there was no effect of the clouds on the people below and in this way, repenting, the clouds returned to their homes.369.

gurmukhi: kwnH aupwr lXo kr mo igr eyk prI nih bUMd su pwnI ]Pyr khI his kY muK qy hir ko mGvw ju BXo muh swnI ]
transliteration: Kaahn Oupaar Layo Kar Mao Gir Ek Parinah(i) Boond Su Paanee|| Pher Kahihas(i) Kai Moukh Te Har(i) Ko Maghvaa Ju Bhayo Muh Saanee||
translation: Krishna uprooted the mountain and placed it on his hand and not even one drop of water fell on the earth; then Krishna said smilingly, “Who is this Indra who will confront me?

gurmukhi: mwr frXo mur mY miD kItB swrXo hsY mGvw pq mwnI ]gopn mY Bgvwn khI soaU PYl prI jg bIc khwnI ]370]
transliteration: Maar Daryo Mur Mai Madh(i) Keetabh Mdaryo Hamai Maghvaa Pat Maanee|| Gopan Mai Bhagvaan Kahisooo Phail Parijag Beech Kahaanee||370||
translation: “I had killed Madhu and Kaitabh also and this Indra had come to kill me; in this way, whatever words were uttered by the Lord (Krishna) amongst gopas, they spread throughout the world like a story.370.

gurmukhi: gopn kI krby khu r`C sq`kiRq pY hir jI jb kopy ]ieau igr ky qr BXo auiT TwiF mnY rup kY pg ky hir ropy ]
transliteration: Goapan Kikarbe Kauh Rachchh Satkkrit Pai Har(i) Jijab Kope|| Io Gir Ke Tar Bhyo Outh(i) Thaadh(i) Manai Roup Kai Pag Ke Har(i) Rope||
translation: When Krishna became angry on Indra for the protection of gopas, then he fell down and got up like the one whose foot slips away;

gurmukhi: ijau jug AMq mY AMqk hÍY kir jIvn ky sB ky aur Gopy ]ijau jn ko mn hoq hY lop iqsI ibD myG Bey sB lopy ]371]
transliteration: Jio Juh Ant Mai Antak Hvai Kar(i) Jeevan Ke Sabh Ke Ur Ghope|| Jio Jan Ko Man Hot Hai Lop Tisibidh Magh Bhae Sabh Lope||371||
translation: At the end of the age, all the world of beings terminated and then a new world arises gradually; just as the mind of an ordinary man sometimes falls down and sometimes rises very high, in the same manner, all the clouds disappeared.371.

gurmukhi: hoie sq`kiRq aUpr ko psu rwK leI sB gop dPw ]iqn myG ibdwr dey iCn mY ijn dYq krY sB eyk gPw ]
transliteration: Hoe Satakkrit Oopar Ko Pas(u) Ko Pas(u) Raakh Laisabh Gop Daphaa|| Tin Megh Bidaar Dae Chhin Mai Jin Dait Darai Sabh Ek Gadhaa||
translation: Lowering the prestige of Indra, Krishna saved the gopas and the animals from destruction; just as a demon devours a being at one time only, in the same manner, all the clouds were destroyed in an instant;

gurmukhi: kir kauqk pY irpu twr dey ibnhI Drey sr sXwm jPw ]sB gopn kI krbY khu r`C su s`kRn lIn lpyt sPw ]372]
transliteration: Kar(i) Kaoutak Pai Rip(u) Taar Dae Binhidharae Sar Syaam Japhaa|| Sabh Gopan Kikarbai Kauh Rachchh Su Sakkran Leen Lapet Saphaa||372||
translation: With his amorous play, Krishna routed all his enemies and all the people began to kill Krishna and in this way, Indra folded up his maya for the protection of gopas.372.

gurmukhi: ju leI sB myG lpyt sBw Aru lIno hY p`b aupwr jbY ]ieh rMck so ieh hY grUE igr ic`q krI mn bIc sBY ]
transliteration: Ju Laisabh Megh Lapet Sabhaa Ar(u) Leeno Hai Pabh Oupaar Jabai|| Eh Ranchak So Eh Hai Darooo Gir Chint Kariman Beech Sabhai||
translation: When the clouds went away and Krishna uprooted the mountain, then removing his anxiety from his mind that mountain seemed very light to him;

gurmukhi: ieh dYqn ko mrqw krqw suK hY idivXw jIX dwn AbY ]ieh ko qum DXwn Dro sB hI nih DXwn Dro qum Aaur kbY ]373]
transliteration: Eh Daitan Ko Martaa Kartaa Soukh Hai Diviyaa Jeeya Daan Bhai|| Ek Ko Toum Dhyaan Ddaro Sabh Hinah(i) Dhyaan Ddaro Toum Aur Kabai||373||
translation: Krishna is the destroyer of the demons, giver of the comforts and the donor of the life-force; all the people should meditate on him, forsaking all meditations on others.373.
